list_definition.definition: standing straight up at right angles to the earth’s surface, or to a horizontal plane or line; upright

list_ex_of_english: In the later work the curving rhythms have given way to a system of verticals and horizontals, broken only by the forty-five degree diagonals of roof-tops and trees.
In fact, the place of the edges in the picture imposes the verticals they are associated to.
The use of vertical rules should be avoided.
The point to emphasize is that we assume the permeability k to vary in the vertical direction.
The height of each bar is read from the vertical axis.
Then a horizontal top plane and some form of vertical plane or step are cut.
Here we assume that the wave propagates in the vertical direction.
The repeated verticals of the balustrade reinforce the effect.
